title: Very helpful
body: Received a phone consultation to help with some eczema treatment for my son. The dr was extremly helpful and went out of their way to make sure the correct medication was prescribed

title: Excellent facility
body: Outstanding treatment from start to finish. My cataract surgery was 100% successful. Would definitely recommend and use them again. Another bonus is the convenient location in the town centre with stress-free, designated parking.

title: Great team!
body:
I am a patient with this practice since it was situated on Baillie Street.
Recently we have lost our family member and the practice manager and her team was amazing during this unprecedented times.
I was emotionally supported by the practice manager and was treated like a friend.
Many thanks for your empathy. Keep up with your teamwork.

title: Really good practice
body:
I really rate this GP surgery - the best service I have ever experienced. The team have been fantastic through the Covid crisis - very responsive and have adapted quickly to offer a very efficient service without having to visit. 

In normal times, the app is very easy to use and I’ve always been able to get an appointment when I’ve needed one; if I ever have to call then I’ve not had to wait long on hold.

title: Great care by gynae surgoens
body: I was treated by Newham gynaecology surgeons for a hysterectomy via keyhole surgery and was very pleased with the service and quality of care I received.  Doctors were willing to answer all my questions and the surgical team were excellent. My recovery is going very well due to their expertise.  Thank you to all the nhs staff who looked after me during these difficult time.

title: Lovely Hospital
body: I was quite emotional when I visited the Breast clinic.I went to see the Consultant for a Breast exam first,he and the nurse were very Comforting and put me at ease.Then was sent for a Mammogram,they Lady who did it was just so nice and talkative and kept me calm.My visit was really nice 10 out of 10 for all Staff that dealt with me.Thank you all you do a great job x

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Service and Support
body:
I just want to say what excellent support I have received from 
Dr Eastaway in recent weeks, especially during these difficult times and for calling me as promised, to ensure I was okay. I appreciate the understanding and concern shown and wanted to express my gratitude. Thank you for your patience and listening skills and thank you to the whole Minet Green Health Practice as you continue to work through these unprecedented times and please keep safe.

title: Extremely useful and effective!
body:
Thank you my therapist( unfortunately, I couldn’t mention the name who was so helpful, according to moderation rules) and Croydon IAPT for your help and support during my difficult time.

During the pandemic, I lost more than half of my income and was struggling to pay my bills. This got me into depression and anxiety. I contacted my GP and he referred to Croydon IAPT.

I found the therapy was very useful and healing. The therapist I had was very competent and understanding. It was encouraging to work with him. I meant to have sessions every other week, but persuaded my therapist to have every week( My anxiety was probably be the reason). My therapist kindly agreed. Half way through the programme, I felt better and start looking for jobs, didn’t get the time to do the exercise given in the course. However, the therapist gave me the push I needed to complete the exercise. My therapist was very patient with me and explained to me the importance of completing it. I realised that it was well worth spending time on it.

At the start of the therapy, I had a severe level of anxiety and severe level of low mood. After completing the course of therapy; my worries are non existent, I gained positive energy, feel motivated and my anxiety level is mild. 

I’d highly recommend the tools and techniques taught in this service to those struggling to manage their worries. It is extremely useful and effective.

Thank you my therapist. Without your care and support, I wouldn’t be how I am now.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: A Excellent team of People
body: I had the procedure Flexi- sigmoidoscopy the treatment which was given to me was of an high standard. All who was handing my care, was exceptional they was all friendly, very proffesional. Myself observed how the staff looking after patient's they received the same excellent standard of care. They all made me feel comfortable due to fact I was very nervous. Who ever is in charge of this great team I would like you to read this to them and let them know they are amazing.

title: Great practice
body: I was very grateful the senior GP at the practice was able to see me with his usual efficiency and cheerfulness (even at 7 in the morning!) which left the rest of my day clear to fulfil other commitments

title: First phone call
body: The man on the phone told me there is a 2 month to years waiting list , he said to me “ I’ll be honest, could be years . Told me to stop talking about my most dear loved ones who have died ( including my 5 month old son) Terribly disrespectful to my loved ones . I feel like I don’t matter to anyone in this life anyway and he confirmed my beliefs that nobody cares , what’s the point in carrying on! Feel more suicidal after phone call.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thanks in memory of Mum
body:
We are writing to thank [the hospice] and all the nurses, doctors and Macmillan nurses (Nicola and Sophie) who looked after our Mum so well during her last few days. We cannot thank you enough for her care.  
As a small token of appreciation we have provided a generous donation in her memory from all our family. Please use the funds as best you can in looking after your patients. We are also very impressed with some of the volunteers we met and hope that in the future we will also be able to volunteer our services.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Unable to make contact
body: I have tried calling today only to find that the surgery is on lunch from 12 to 2 pm.  It doesn’t state on their website that they don’t open over the lunch period.  Very difficult to contact when you’re working.

title: Exceptional Practice
body: Always so helpful and understanding front line desk admin absolutely excellent with help and attitude .... doctors are the best team ever this surgery is a real credit to the nhs

title: Phone
body:
Ring ring.  Never any answer.
Ring ring, ring ring ring ring. Click.
Phone back.  Ring ring ring ring.  No answer.  Click.  Again and again and again.

author: Happy eater
title: I developed a problem with swallowing food and drink.
body:
Around this time last year, I began having a problem eating a meal. I often had indigestion or worse brought food up again. Just after Christmas I decided to visit my local GP who set in motion a fast track investigation.  
Given that the pandemic took hold whilst the tests were being done all I can say is that I can not fault the service provided by the consultant who oversaw the investigation and the Upper GI team that performed the surgery that was needed to reduce my problem.  
I have learned since that Broomfield hospital is a centre for this type of keyhole surgery, which was very fortunate for me as I live nearby.  
Many thanks to all concerned for their excellent service.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust
Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Ekim
title: Day care cardiac department
body: Appointment time 11.30, did not get any information. I recognise that emergency take precedence but I would like to be informed why I did not get into the operating room until 3.00pm. At my admitting no one asked if I was diabetic? The overall care was good but areas could be improved. Sorry to be a killjoy but I feel this needs highlighting.

author: Patient aid
title: Kindness of a Hospital assistant
body: I asked a ward orderly for directions to the Pharmacy. He told me it was the other side of the Hospital and noticed that I looked weary and had a small child and walking stick. He offered to push us both in a wheelchair an offer which I gladly accepted. I have MS and this kindness was so appreciated by me that I have told everyone I know.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: receptionists
body:
you can never get an appointment at this surgery when needed, hang on the telephone forever, also the surgery telephoned after having a blood test I have been very ill, I missed the call but they asked to call back straight away which I did but couldn't get through the lines were turned off , so living quite near i walked around to the surgery to ask what they called me for , and they told me they couldn't talk to me right now to wait for a telephone call again the nxt afternoon its covid times?, I said but you called me just 5 mins ago can you not tell me what it was for as I am here ? Receptionist said no tommorrow afternoon now 
The receptionist are very bad at this surgery they think they are God

title: Absolutely brilliant
body:
Springfield surgery is absolutely brilliant. Having had experiences of several GP practices across Yorkshire in the past 15 years, I have to say that Springfield is second to none. The receptionists are helpful and efficient and are always keen to do their all to ensure patients get the help they need. The nurses are kind and supportive. Their gentle manner makes their patients feel safe and listened to. The GPs are incredibly dedicated. 

I am deeply grateful for the support of my GP at Springfield over the past few years. After the birth of my daughter in 2016, I experienced the most difficult period in my life. One of the most fundamentally helpful things I experienced at Springfield was the continuity of care. Whenever I rang up to make an appointment, I was able to request to see the same GP. If she was planning to be off work, she would recommend another GP who knew about my history. I felt incredibly supported and I always knew I could reach out for help if I needed it.

I will forever be indebted to my GP for the way that she fought for me relentlessly during the darkest moments of my life. She always went above and beyond. I have had several referrals into secondary care over the past few years. My GP would always chase up these referrals and would advocate for me. She was my voice when I was voiceless. Often her determination was the only reason that I was able to access the treatment I needed against all the odds. 

As a result of all of the care and support at Springfield surgery, I am doing really well. I am the most well I have been in a very long time. I am finally able to move forwards with the areas of my life that have been on hold. None of this would have been possible without my GP. 

To all the staff at Springfield Surgery - thank you from the bottom of my heart. Thank you for being so dedicated to your patients. Thank you for treating them with kindness. Thank you for all you do.

title: Very efficient
body:
It took a while to get through on the telephone but after that they were very efficient.
The staff were very thorough.

title: Prompt and effective service
body:
Same day call with a GP provided and the GP then asked me to attend the same evening for an in person assessment and then said they would arrange appropriate referral. Reception staff also friendly and helpful, although there is a wait of almost 20 minutes to speak to them when the phone rings.
Cannot fault the quick service for appointment which is especially appreciated due to the strain the NHS is operating under. I am finding the telephone appointment system, providing opportunity for speaking to a GP the same day and then arranging to come in only if necessary, is actually an easier and faster way of addressing most health concerns than previously when appointments were all in person and hope this continues.

title: Fantastic receptionists
body:
I’m recovering from an illness and have a fairly complex prescription regime. I’ve managed to make a mess of re-ordering a couple of times and had to ask for help as I was running out of vital medicines. The reception team sorted this out for me without any fuss and with efficiency and above all kindness and concern. This is just what you need when you’re feeling a bit low. I do so appreciate it and feel that they, the receptionists, are the impressive front end of a very good practice.
Thank you.

title: Caring practice
body: Thank you to the whole team that provide a caring friendly service.  What fantastic doctors always there to go beyond to see the right care is put in place.  Thank you

title: Impossible to get service
body: There’s no point registering with this surgery; each time I need to see a Dr I have to continuously call from 8am to the time (30 to 40 mins) that they eventually answer only to be told there are no more appointments.  I have asked for their complaints procedure and reception failed to acknowledge that they have one.  Today is not abnormal: I called over 160 times and never got an answer.  My partner called on her phone for the same period and it eventually rang only to be picked up and immediately hung up on.  The service, if that’s the word, is non-existent.  I asked in person to see the office manager to be told that they don’t have one.  All this place does is employ gatekeepers.  The medical staff must be getting paid, they have over 10,000 patients, it’s just they don’t seem to want to see too many of them at any one time.  This is NOT my idea of a service.  It’s not my idea of a Drs surgery either.  It just seems to be a money mill to me.  I have to repeatedly call 111 so what’s the point of me being registered there?

title: Caring practice
body: Safe environment competent and caring staff who put you at ease. Put the patients needs at the fore. Thank you

title: Consistently helpful
body: The staff are helpful, pleasant and efficient. I  had a short wait but when in with clinicians never feel they are rushing me out for the next appt.

title: Dedicated and informative
body: Whilst my son was in this department he received great nursing care .the staff were always helpful and informative and helped him to receive the correct treatment I can not thank the staff and managers enough for enabling my son to regain his confidence and self esteem to carry on living his life in the community.

title: Targeted help
body: Earlier this year I was diagnosed as being in the danger zone for diabetes. The practitioner referred me to a course which helped to the degree that, having taken the advice on board, I am now in the normal range. I have been supported by phone calls to keep regular checks and now there is no going back. Thank you

title: Fantastic care
body: I must thank all of the midwives, nurses and doctors that have cared for our new grandson. He was deliberately delivered weeks early because of the risk of him growing too large. The pre and after care has been outstanding. The fact that mum has been kept in to ensure complete safety is commendable. This is our second lockdown grandson. The first was in a different hospital and the level of care did not compare to Queens in any way unfortunately. Thank you so much for all you do for us.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice
body:
I found the reception staff friendly and efficient at the Riverside Practice, clear markings and distancing measures in place, everyone wearing masks and lots of hand  sanitisers placed strategically. 
I felt completely at safe and at ease throughout my visit. 
I would highly recommend the Hurley and Riverside Practice

author: TheChristmasfairy
title: Fantastic care.
body:
I was apprehensive about going in for induction without my husband present however the nursing staff made me feel right at home. I would like to thank all the staff from the auxiliaries, midwives and doctors for their professionalism, kindness and care to me and my baby from induction ward/ labour ward/theatre/recovery & baby ward at Ulster hospital maternity unit.  
A special thank you to Midwife Susan who looked after both me and my husband while on the labour ward. Her knowledge, experience shone through and I knew both me and my unborn baby were in the best of hands. Sadly her 12 hour shift had to end but she made sure there was a seamless handover to the next midwife who also was amazing in the short time we had with her (sorry I can't remember her name) but she held my hand through a lot of tears as I headed for an emergency c section and made sure I knew exactly what was ahead.  
Following the birth of my son despite not being able to have my husband stay with us beyond recovery, was very positive. The staff were very attentive especially with supporting my recovery from the section and nothing was too much trouble. The hospital during my stay was also spotless which is a credit to the domestic staff and I must admit combined with the friendliness of all the staff, there were times I almost forgot I was in a hospital.  
Many thanks Charlie & his mummy

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body:
I contracted COVID 19 whilst at work, I got worse during the night, I declared positive next day. Apart from the constitutional symptoms, I developed difficulty in breathing and almost having no exercise tolerance. I contacted my emergency department, they carefully attended me,  and did all which I timely needed. They were really concerned about me. I was transferred to Ward C 6 then. They tailored the best treatment options for my condition and made my stay on the ward comfortable. 
I realised that I am so lucky being a part of ELHT. They whole team from emergency medicine physicians, medics, nurses, investigations, physiotherapists, health care assistance, porters, cleaners, they are marvellous. They are highly professional, they are sympathetic, always smiling, using best energies for their patients. They are angels on earth. Patients are sleeping and they are caring for their comfort and ultimate health out come. I will always remember my hospital stay. I gratitude this amazing team. God bless them. They definitely deserve high ranks in heaven and I am sure they will go straight there. AMEEN
Dr. TAHIR ZEB

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Appalling and completely incompetent
body: No matter the time of day the phone line is engaged as they will keep you on hold sometimes for over 15 minutes. Every staff member is rude. They will ask your personal information in a surgery full of people. I can never get an appointment and my child 3 years old has also been refused appointments even when ringing as soon as they open, that’s if you can get through it can sometimes take over an hour to get through. Complete and utter shambles. They need to employ some staff with manners.

title: Exasperating experience
body:
End-to-end a very poor patient journey. There are 2 receptionists and 2 GPs I have seen at this practice. One receptionist is exceptionally polite and friendly, and always answers my questions happily... while the other receptionist (who I've spoken to more often) is very rude and condescending, and always interrupts me.

Neither GP gives me more than 5 minutes time face to face or on the phone, they never let me finish a sentence and then get angry if I interrupt to ask a question. Neither GP is helpful in helping me understand my condition or feasible treatment options. They always sound like they want to get rid of me as soon as possible, and often belittle/minimise my condition.

While one of the GPs is at least sympathetic, the other comes across as arrogant and patronising - they leave me feeling like I am a child who doesn't know anything about my own symptoms or long-term conditions.

I always leave feeling frustrated and humiliated. Would not recommend at all.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: No reply
body:
I haven't been able to contact this place since the pandemic. They turned off patient access and i can't use a phone. They know about my disability. They denied my human right for access to medical care.

The ignored all my emails.

title: Flu Jab
body: Very pleased indeed with the service I received - it was done with great care and attention to detail

title: Marvelous assistance
body: Due to a medical condition I needed to call the surgery quickly to assist me with a painful issue.  I was greeted with an amazingly helpful person who went out of their way to get me what was required.  With the state of today with the ongoing pandemic, it was wonderful to hear a truly helpful voice.  Fabulous

title: Why taking off the mask?
body: I am so disappointed, shocked and worried after having a blood test in this surgery. I was shocked when I saw the nurse who took my blood, pulled her mask down while I still was in the room! One would assume the room is clean and safe. If she does this after each patient and even while they are still there, how can we trust having a blood test in this surgery????!!! Unbelievable. Is there no protocol? So this means only patients are supposed to keep the nurses safe and not vice versa!

title: CANT THANK CORONARY CARE PRESTON ENOUGH
body:
How do you thank a whole department for saving the life of a loved one, my wife was so poorly when admitted to CCU and its only because of the care, diligence and professionalism of the Nurses and Doctors of this dept that she is here today. 
My total respect and eternal gratitude to each and every one of the Coronary Care Unit of the Royal Preston Hospital.
God bless and keep you all safe.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Pinkbobblehat3
title: Thank you to all for caring for her so well.
body:
We had to visit Glasgow Childrens Hospital last night after a bed time gymnastics accident! It's every parents worst nightmare, especially during a global pandemic but I have to say every aspect of care was flawless.  
From the friendly HCA who met us as the door to ask the essential covid questions, who spoke to my daughter and not just to me which I think is really important in any setting and generally made the situation a bit less scary with his positive attitude.  
Social distance and PPE measures were all in place and we felt safe as a result.  
Our triage nurse Rachel was lovely. She was so patient with our daughter and let her lead the way she was cared for and accepted her boundaries. Not to mention rewarding her for her bravery with a rainbow ice lolly which was the best part of the whole experience .  
Dr McMaster ST3 came to review her eye and nose in the minor injuries unit and he too was very friendly and gentle. He completely respected her feelings / when she was scared. We've seen a few doctors throughout the years with our 3 kids, some of whom I must admit I hoped never specialised in the area as they lacked the gentle and compassionate touch required for working with children but Dr McMaster was completely attuned to kids needs.  
Thankfully a quick visit with no serious injuries but thank you to all for caring for her so well.

title: Thoroughly professional
body: I visited in the middle of the second wave of Covid and was so impressed with how clean and organised everything was. The Practice Nurse was fantastic and really put me at ease. Thanks as ever for your care.

title: Very professional, thorough service.
body: The appointment was on time, strict Covid rules in evidence. I received a very thorough series of examinations, questions were answered and results shown to me. I was very grateful to the staff, professional and pleasant

title: GPs genuinely want to help
body:
Amazing surgery. I've been with this surgery for 3 years now And then managed to find out the root cause of my ongoing illnesses which my previous surgery wouldn't go past blood test. Anytime there's a new problem I get seen or tested right away.
During Covid19, the online triage form has been very effective compared to my parents who are in Northwest London and they get it definitely difficult to get through for appointments. And the safety measures are not as robust as this place.
As of November, they have a new telephone system in place which I actually prefer it because It's not always about appointments and also you now get to know what number are you in the queue.

The staff are really helpful, They try to resolve any of your queries. And again I just want to say the GPS are amazing they've managed to diagnose and refer me to the right specialist which came out with the right conclusions on analysis that are difficult to diagnose such as in terms of invisible disability. I would give 10 stars if I could. Thank you.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: All staff were fantastic ,could not have asked for anything better,from arriving to leaving all staff were fantastic.

author: JBlack
title: Mental health services during the pandemic
body:
Around this time last year, I made plans to end my life as I felt overwhelmed by depression and anxiety and couldn’t see any way through. I was lucky in many ways that I had excellent support from an NHS counsellor, who took steps to secure support from the crisis team (who were also amazing) as they spotted that I was becoming very unwell. Although things worsened, I was enormously grateful for the reassurance and support that the crisis team provided. I ended up spending a few weeks in hospital and was discharged back to the crisis team and then my local Community Mental Health Team. Then the pandemic hit.  
I expected there to be an impact, but as mental health was being more widely discussed in the media and workplace, I felt increasingly invisible. I know full well that I am not the only person who needs support, that others are struggling around me and services have had to adapt to cope. But this NHS that I passionately defend is failing me. Instead of getting better, I feel at breaking point again with nowhere to turn.My current support consists of periodic phone appointments with a lovely Dr, where my medications are reviewed and a brief attempt is made at reassuring me that really I am on a waiting list for some therapeutic support, but without an indication of how long this will be. There have been various errors made with medications, promises of support made that haven’t happened and the chasing I have had to do to make anything happen at all, at a time when I feel at my most vulnerable. The cold reality of the situation is best summed up by my conversation with a senior staff member at the CMHT team who told me that of course I was important to them, but they were busy dealing with other priorities such as actively suicidal people. And then went off to deal with something else. The message seems to be that to get any support, you really do need to be actively trying to end your life.For nearly a year now I have fought the urge to do just that, and I can’t tell you how much it saddens me that a professional responsible for my care did not understand the significant impact their words would have on someone who went into hospital rather than take that option.I know there is no magic wand with mental health, but I have asked for help because I need it. I really do. I just want some help.

title: Great practice
body: Excellent service. Really quick and helpful advice with a warm and understanding tone from the doctor. Multiple pieces of advice given and medication suggestions. Quick easy prescriptions too.

title: Prescription clerk fantastic
body: Had to deal with prescription clerk again today. She always gives great service. She has a caring polite manner.  Thank you for all your help always .

title: Really understanding of mental health
body: Everyone I’ve had experience with at the Aspen, from admin to nurses & doctors, has been so understanding of mental health. I’ve never felt treated differently or stigmatised by anyone at the surgery. 2 Drs in particular have been so kind and shown me a lot of compassion, and made adjustments like blind weighing. Thank you!

title: Incredibly efficient registration and new patient…
body:
We've recently moved to this area and asked a local pharmacist which GP he recommended.  We subsequently registered online with the Brentford Family Practice, a fairly straightforward procedure. 
We were registered within four days (which included a weekend) and were immediately sent details of how to register for the online service.  We've also had new patient health checks and flu jabs arranged.
The speed and efficiency of this proactive service has really impressed us, having previously been been registered with a practice that never seemed to master their online presence and were not nearly so helpful.

title: Brilliant midwives
body:
I had both my children at north Middlesex and loved the modern facilities, easy parking and low wait times. From pre-natal to birth, one thing that really stood out was the warmth and professionalism of all the staff. My husband couldn’t be with me at scans or triage so it made a huge difference to be in the care of people who were so professional and kind. When I was admitted for induction one midwife in particular (who I’m sadly not allowed to name here) went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and fully informed. She stayed with me even when she didn’t have to and as a result of her care I could not have felt in safer hands. 
What really overshadowed things was the post natal care. In particular, on the delivery ward one matron was very brusque and sent a cleaner in to prepare my room for the next person when I had literally just finished being stitched up. It was quite a traumatic birth and to have a stranger in the room mopping the floor round your bed while you hold your baby for the first time felt really intrusive. I was hurried down to the post natal ward where there was no bed for me and without my husband there, I remember just breaking down in tears and feeling very alone. The staff there were nice enough but clearly very over stretched and it took forever for them to answer peoples call buttons or to discharge me. So overall, it wasn’t perfect but no hospital is and the many good points far outweigh the few bad. I wouldn’t hesitate to go there again if I’m brave enough to go for baby 3!

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: I have an appointment
body: Received text, after original telephone call but no address. The phone is never picked up I really wish the NHS would scrap these businesses and do scans in-house. These external companies must cost more in the long run.

title: Good practice
body:
Had Saturday morning flu injection, very efficiently managed. 
I have since seen a Doctor for a more serious problem which has been dealt with very quickly through her referral to the hospital. Most grateful.

title: Very organised flu clinic
body:
The doctors, nurses and office staff are very helpful and kind. Thank you for your continued support during a difficult year.

The flu clinic was well organised.

title: Excellent service
body: Our recent experience was to receive a flu jab The experience was excellent - the whole process ran with military precision. We were in and out in a very short space of time. Thank you

author: FTiree
title: Epidural denial
body:
In April, I gave birth to my baby at Glasgow Queen Elizabeth Hospital. I was denied an epidural in maternity assessment when I arrived. My intention is not to blame anyone. I just need some sort of closure and want to make sure that no other women go through the same experience than I did.  
I am French but have been working and living in Glasgow for the past two years. Below is a timeline of the events that happened during my labour, on at Glasgow Queen Elizabeth Hospital. It was during the first coronavirus peak; partners were only allowed in the labour ward.  
My contractions started late evening. I was at home with my partner. My partner phoned the hospital to let them know that labour had started.We phoned again in the early hours of the following morning to give an update. I was advised to stay at home. We phoned as the contractions were becoming more intense at this point I expressed my wish to be assessed. A few hours later I was admitted to the Maternity Assessment ward on my own as partners were not allowed. As I was only 2/3 cm dilated, I was sent back home to allow labour to establish further.  
Later that morning I phoned to give an update on how I was doing since attending the hospital. Late afternoon that day I phoned again as contractions were becoming more intense and lasted longer. I was asked if I wanted to attend. I said yes. I again attended the maternity assessment ward on my own for the second time. I was welcomed by a midwife who took care of me during all my stay in the assessment ward. The contractions were strong. My dilation was at 4/5 cm. The midwife told me that they would get me to the labour ward. Unfortunately, all the beds were taken, so I had to wait on my own in the assessment ward for 2 hours.  
As soon as I arrived, I told the midwife that I wanted an epidural. They replied that I was coping really well, had managed to stay at home for a long time, so that might not be necessary. They mentioned morphine and also asked me if I had considered water birth; to which I answered no. They came back a few minutes later to tell me that actually all the pools were closed because of coronavirus. Did not mention epidural or morphine anymore and just gave me dihydrocodeine and took my blood.  
I felt that the intensity of the contractions had increased dramatically. The midwife phoned the labour ward to see if there was any free bed. I was admitted to the labour ward and finally reunited with my partner. During the handover between the two midwives, I could hear them talking, the information passed on was that I might want an epidural but was coping well so would probably not need it. It was shift change and a new midwife took over my care. During the handover, my partner and I again overheard them discussing that I might want an epidural. We both reacted at the same time and stated quite vehemently that I did want an epidural. The midwife took my request into account, but we now had to wait for my blood results to come back. As stated above, my blood had only just been taken while I had been on the maternity assessment center. By the time, the results arrived, the anesthetist was taken on an emergency. We therefore had to wait for the epidural siting.  
The anesthetist arrived to discuss epidural, afterwards the epidural procedure commenced. The epidural was sited by the anesthetist, but a very short time later my baby was born. The epidural did not work. I went through the labour with forceps, episiotomy and second degree- tears only using other pain relief (which did not even work at the end as I had to remove the mask to answer the anesthetist’s questions). I ended up with a massive scar.  
The night shift labour ward midwife was brilliant and did the best they could with the situation that was inherited. The gynecologist who delivered the baby, also did an amazing job.  
I do not understand however how, the first midwife who took care of me, could decide on their own, that I was coping well and might not need an epidural while I had clearly stated that I wanted one from the start. I am a self-contained person and I have never expressed pain in a dramatic way.  
Should I deduce that in the 21st century Scotland, the only way to have an epidural is to scream and cry to show your pain? Are self-contained persons excluded from stronger pain relief because they seem to cope too well?Does this mean that the NHS consider that staff opinion is more valuable than the patient's wishes or does this depend on the person on shift when you arrive? The second thing that I do not understand is why I had to wait for two hours to have my blood taken. We lost precious minutes waiting for blood results to have the epidural sited. Having them earlier might have change the course of events.  
I do not feel any sort of pride having been able to go through a forceps, episiotomy and second-degree labour only using gas & air. I just feel traumatised and extremely disappointed. I had never felt so vulnerable in my whole life. Instead of being listened to by the persons who were supposed to take care of me, they decided for me. Because of this experience, I am not sure I want more children.  
Once I stopped having nightmares about my labour, I began to do a bit of research. I was astonished to discover that a scandal of epidural denial in the UK had been highlighted in a newspaper back in January 2020. The official inquiry that followed concluded that women in labour were not receiving epidural when they asked for it and that this was in breach of official guidelines. I was able to find several articles in the mainstream news which covered this topic.  
  
I keep wondering:  
• How could I live this kind of situation, 3 months after the issue was highlighted and only a month after the findings of the official investigations were released?  
• Which process is in place to ensure that pain relief options are discussed with women and received when they ask for it?  
We have been living in Scotland for 2 years and have enjoyed every part of it. I am extremely proud that my baby was born here. It is just a shame that our only bad experience here is the one that was supposed to be the most beautiful.

title: Fantastic helpful caring and dedicated.
body:
The wife and I have been patients of Old Station since it opened and before that White Lion, for over 33 years.
We both have a lot of health issues and without this practice our lives could be as bad as unbearable, yet with all the help and care we receive we feel we have a lot to look forward to.

It's when you need them the most that you just realise how fantastic these guys are, but also on our yearly check ups we actually look forward to because we know if anything further needs looking at they find it.

We stay in this area because of the needs we have and honestly we believe we wouldn't be looked after like we are at Old Station, I hate to say Old Station because it's not the building but the wonderful caring people that work there.
We almost know everyone by now and every single person does a wonderful job which makes and incredible team.

I do get lost for words just how much appreciation we have for this team because every single time we have needed help we have been cared for so well.

title: Eye Appointment
body:
This Practice has followed all the government's guidelines to a very high standard. 
Patient care was also to a high standard 
I was very impressed at my appointment by the professionalism of all the staff who was there
Thankyou

title: Flu vaccine programme
body: Had my flu vaccine beginning of Oct. Would like to mention that it was very well organised, staff very helpful and as a patient with severe RA, and feeling nervous mixing with others during Covid, I felt very safe at all times. Well done.

title: Can't fault the colonoscopy dept.
body: Was extremely nervous on arrival. All the staff were extremely caring & attentative, including the doctor doing the procedure which was very much appreciated I can tell you! & the procedure was nothing to worry about, a little discomfort here & there. Won't be nervous next time!. Very lovely people 😊. Thankyou.

title: Very good flue jab
body: Both me and my husband went together we were in and out in no time , very well organised  , kept the social distance

title: It is so efficient-Thanks
body: I understand all people will have different opinions, but I have to say that over the years and in particular now, the service has been superb! I have presented with various new symptoms and sought reassurance and treatment for ongoing chronic conditions and from consultations to ordering repeat prescriptions through E Consult it has been faultless-A Good Team Giving an Excellent Service for which my wife and I are extremely grateful, thank you.

title: Extremely Happy with our GP Practice
body: We recently had our flu vaccine and were surprised at the well oiled conveyor belt system the practice put into place, in at the front, out at the back, temperature taken at start, everybody socially distanced and masked.  An excellent system which will probably be repeated for the COVID vaccine hopefully.  Most impressed.

title: Flu Jab, full military style!
body: My appointment was for 11.42 precisely and they weren't kidding. In and out in 3 minutes, with staff already waiting and hurrying us along.  Very efficient, very professional. Great experience. (And I haven't had flu either.)

title: Great Practice
body:
Had my Flu & Shingles Jab.s on the Saturday.
Was offered blood pressure check also which I accepted 
Staff very friendly & polite

author: Doubledykes mummy
title: Lack of information on what to expect
body:
I had a terrible experience in hospital some years ago, which left me with PTSD type anxiety which has never really left me. However since becoming quite seriously unwell i have had to rely on hospital specialists who have been excellent and restored my faith. Thanks to cardiology, infection diseases physicians and the OPAT services; truly excellent care. Recently I have spent a lot of time in various different hospitals and have had the time to compare them with each other, and I actually was feeling very lucky that Forth Valley was my local hospital.  
Last week I was admitted to Forth Valley again but I had never been in a surgical ward with a complaint about abdominal pain before. Overall the medical and nursing staff were excellent, especially considering the whole Covid19 situation, all the new measures added to a hospital keyworkers already busy day. I was treated with respect and care. I had various procedures that were new for me and the majority were well explained.However there was one procedure where the information was severely lacking with the result of complete humiliation and distress for me. I feel embarrassed to be sharing this story but, it is an experience that could easily have been made more compassionate and less traumatic for me. I had to have an enema which I have never experienced before nor had any knowledge about. Prior to and during the procedure, which was actually fine and not as bad one might imagine, I asked questions about it to the nurse. The procedure itself was explained very well at the time but they omitted to explain what would happen after it was administered. This omission led to me going through unexpected pain and then the humiliating experience of soiling myself and my clothing on several occasions until I had no clean clothing of my own. I then sat very upset in soiled clothes because I had no other option. Some time later an auxiliary nurse saw my distress, pulled the curtain for privacy and compassionately explained that it was very common occurrence. They immediately brought me fresh hospital clothes, incontinence pads and prepared my bed in anticipation for 'an accident'. I immediately felt better and less degraded, although I was still very emotional about it all. Now I just feel stupid that I didn't realise how the enema would work. Please🙏 🙏🙏🙏 could you fully prepare your patient for consequences of any procedure/treatment that you do where there may be unexpected symptoms. Not all patients may want to know but in this case it would have been far less traumatic and degrading for me. I was in a shared room with 3 other patients so the humiliation was even worse, me a 50+ year old lady quiet and anxious, sitting in soiled clothes and probably smelling a bit.I was very, very upset and writing this I am actually crying again so this needs to be taken seriously and addressed. I would not wish someone else to feel this way. It is an easy thing to rectify, staff administering an enema just need to explain all the things that can commonly happen afterwards. The auxiliary nurse and night staff nurse both agreed my symptoms were common and normal and helped with my pain and my upset. I have not made this post to get any one single staff member into trouble but just to have this highlighted and cascaded to staff members carrying out the same procedure. Let us be informed and thus dignified. A little explanation would have made a hospital stay more memorable for the correct reasons; that NHS staff work tirelessly for the sake of their patients and are true heroes.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: CB-19
title: Gynaecology
body:
I attended in late October and at the time felt the appointment had gone well. A treatment plan was discussed and agreed, which I was happy with.  
However once I received my letter from the doctor it seems we were at completely different appointments. The treatment in the letter, which I was to receive from my GP bore no relation to what had been agreed.  
I called gynaecology to ask to speak to the doctor I saw - zero response.  
I called my GP who understood exactly what I was explaining and agreed to write to the gynaecologist I saw. I’ve since called back to gynaecology again - zero response.  
So the 70-mile round trip was a waste of time and I am yet to start treatment.  
I now have no confidence in this department.

author: Dantb83
title: Getting up with a purpose
body:
The short version of my journey i want to start by saying I've got up this morning with a purpose. I've got stuff to do today, im active in my recovery and that's a true blessing that i take seriously because over 10 mths ago it wasn't like this. i was in my last and worst relapse i need whoever to believe me and feel what I'm saying - using and knowing there is a solution to me not using is a horrible place to be in my last relapse was a time where self sabotage was at it's most powerful for me. A close friend of mine said to me he was expecting a phone call that I had passed away through my using. In the end I was taking multiple substances and taking risks like the world was about to end, like I said knowing that there is help. People who care for me was saying it's getting too much to watch but would still try and help support me.By the grace of God i took help from many of my true friends and i ended up on a detox plan in Stockport with a plan to go in another treatment house in Bacup. When I got to Glen valley I'd used that morning and the manager picked up on this and asked me to come back the next day. I was so desperate and with no other choice did this. While there I met the detox nurse Kelly and the love care and support I was given by Kelly, the staff and my peers at Glen valley was absolutely what i needed even though I've used for many years this was my first physical detox. I struggled and on many of occasions my dark thoughts of I can't do this nearly had me out of the door. Kelly i hope you know and feel what you do for people changes lives. I'm sat here today nearly 9mths clean and sober again. I'd like to offer any support i can to any newcomers who need support or someone to listen or talk to. I'm not guna say my detox was easy and i'm not guna say recovery is easy, but what i will say, it's so much better than using. My soul and heart was dying. Today right here right now in this moment I'm alive with a purpose and a smile. I think ya know what life ain't that bad for me that's a true God given miracle and through hard work and love and support from others its available to everyone that needs and wants it. GOD BLESS.  
Kelly you're an absolute Angel, seriously from my heart thank you and I'm sure my mum where she is is also thanking you. XX

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Cancer man
title: Bladder removal
body: I was treated for bladder removal due to cancer. Every aspect of treatment was good. I felt cared for.

author: Bugsey
title: Cannot be faulted
body:
I have now been in the care of the Seamoor unit for close on 2 years and from the first visit which was a little worrying not knowing what was about to happen until the date of writing this feedback I can quite honestly say that all of the staff on reception, nurses and consultants I have been in contact with cannot be faulted. People have been courteous and most considerate in all matters relating to my problem. I have been kept informed of my progress or otherwise and treated most sympathetically.  
If there has been a problem with consultations/treatments at the hospital I have been well informed of any alternative visits. With the advent of Covid-19 the necessity for telephone consultations has not been a problem in fact it appears to be a progressive means of discussion and for my part a preferred option although I can well understand that periodically there will need to be face to face meetings.  
I do not have any adverse comments to make and feel the system works exceptionally well for my part.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: M820
title: Shielding during the pandemic
body:
Throughout this pandemic I have been shielding. I work in the NHS and have being in wards doing patient meals. I'm told that as other people are doing this, so can I. I don’t have a spleen so I am very much terrified of catching this virus. I have tried calling my doctor and the phone number provided in my gov text message but I can’t get any advice about this. Should I be working in hospitals where the risks are high! Where I wash plates cutlery utensils etc. that patients with COVID use. Should I be going into wards that may or may not have COVID patients. Am I safe to be in that environment.  
I am terrified and I have had no support or advice how to go forward. They are expecting me in to work tomorrow as I haven’t received my letter but the hospital has had to shut 3 wards and is very much filling fast with over 90 positive cases. I just don’t know what to do for the best.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Caro2020
title: Filled me with hope
body: Dr Sapcota always filled me with hope, he was always so thorough and kind and a real gentleman, it makes a huge difference when you are not well.

author: Fretful Parent
title: Lack of available support
body:
My son has symptoms of ADHD since the age of 8. I have experienced weekly school complaints regarding his behaviour, but with more emphasis on how this affects 'other children'. Until now my child has only ever received complaints but no support, which as a parent is incredibly disappointing.  
I was so thrilled to hear about CAMHS and their Services / Mission in working with 'all children, adolescents and families referred to them to have access to the most appropriate form of psychological help'. However, I am finding that even when a child is clearly recognised as having an issues, through school and referred by the Doctor the waiting time for acknowledgement from CAMHS is on average 18 months. My issue is that 18 months for a child who is struggling and being ostracised by peers is a long wait! My Doctor has now made 2 calls to the CAMHS team to find out how my son's appointment is coming on and has been told that he has another minmum 6 months before being seen. To put this in perspective, my Son will be nearly at the end of his Schooling before he is offered help from the CAMHS team. The stress and anxiety of not being able to focus at the most crucial time in his education is extremely disheartening, and does not align with the mission nor the service being advertised by CAMHS. My GP actually feels so much empathy and has repeated told me that their hands are tied as this is the CAMHS team area of expertise.  
How do I feel? Disappointed, let down, saddened by the hope that I felt in my son would receive the help he needs to constantly being de-prioritsed and overlooked by a service that is failing to provide the specialist support that is required.  
How does my son feel - abandoned, pushed aside, helpless and that no-one cares.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Bpdgirl
title: Wouldn't recommend not good experiences so far
body:
I dont even know where to start, I have been fobbed off one too many times where they just send me to different services.  
Doesnt seem that half of them are on the same page, I hit a really low point and a cpn discharged me even tho I wasnt ready, a week later I was struggling so much I tried to phone crisis team - got told they couldn't deal with me as my case was closed. I then tried to phone gp, and they couldn't see me that day and to call the following morning. That night I overdosed with no where to turn to. I was lost.  
This wasnt the 1st and it wont b the last I am sure, I was referred back to them and was finally given a decent cpn who listened to me and referred me for psychology. I was on a waiting list for months and they continued to keep in touch as I was defo not over the worst.  
I then finally got a psychologist and have had about 8 appointments but after the 3rd appt, I felt there was no point going into my childhood drama as the psychologist was only going to be able to have a few sessions left.  
Now the psychological team want me to speak to We Are With You which I said I am happy to do, but wish to be placed back into the waiting list for another psychologist as I still have no clue how to handle my emotions ( I have bpd)  
It feels like the team basically dont want me on the waiting list just fobbing me onto another service that can only deal with part of the problem, whereas I know myself I need both help at the same time to overcome the worst... I just wish they would listen and also wish I never moved into this area as my last services was so much better but I had to leave their services due to moving out the catchment area.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Eviesmum
title: Amazing medical practice in Glasgow
body: I recently moved to the area after having a baby girl and joined Auchinairn Medical practice. I have been absolutely delighted with the care myself and my baby girl have received so far. The reception staff are fantastic at prioritising appointments and putting you at ease and the doctors are exemplary in their care. I had a number of concerns with my daughter including reflux and ear infections. Dr Coia in particular was so personable and has really put my mind at ease. She saw my daughter on the same day that I phoned and honestly just made me feel so much better about everything. I just feel that in the middle of a global pandemic, this practice deserves recognition. I also want to highlight how amazing the health visitor has been. Gail has been a massive comfort to me and I know she has firm connections with this practice. I want to thank them so much for being so very professional and for making things so easy at a time when things are so difficult for the NHS.

author: roacat
title: Great care
body:
The care my wife received at NHS Grantham from the nurse and consultant was the best any one could wish for.  
THANK YOU SO MUCH

author: Lucy2shoes
title: Flu injection
body: Well organized at local Gps. Had injection & was out in 10 mins.

author: Lddobson
title: Flu vaccination 2020
body: I has very impressed with the service from start to finish. In and out in 5 minutes but lovely health care professionals keeping things friendly. I’d be very happy if this is how things are run from now on.

title: Lovely receptionists on telephone.
body: Any phone call is dealt with very pleasantly & helpfully and with a good sense of humour, bearing in mind how busy you all are.

title: Nurse
body: I visited the surgery today (25/11/20) for routine test and vaccination. The practice nurse I saw was excellent - she was both friendly and professional. I could not have asked for a better experience - thank you very much.

title: Efficient helpful service
body:
I have recently moved from another surgery. The staff at Portland have made the transfer extremely easy. 

The reception staff that I have dealt with have been very friendly, efficient and helpful. 

I wasn’t really expecting them to be in contact with me but they have been in touch about the flu jab and booked me in and sorted out a minor admin with a minimum of fuss. 

Thank you.

title: Very efficient
body: Had my flu jab, in and out very quickly. They were very professional and efficient, was also offered blood pressure test and weight measured which was also handled very well.

title: Great care
body: I needed to se a GP today with a swollen foot and shoulder problem. I was given an appointment an hour later and was referred for an x-ray, given a prescription and would have been referred for physiotherapy had we not agreed that I could follow exercises found on the internet. Sometimes appointments are not needed. So, thank you and keep it up.

title: Empathetic and professional
body: Always a great service from staff: from friendly and clear receptionists, professional and kind nurses, to the doctors always being thorough and helpful. Thank you for your hard work!!

author: Lilyput
title: Flu vaccine
body: I had never had a flu jab before but because my partner has lung cancer I thought it would be safer for both of us. The nurses were friendly and professional entering the health centre was well organised and also when leaving I didn’t feel anxious at all.

title: Flu jab
body: Excellent efficient organisation by all the great staff.  Didnt have to wait long which was good.  Well done

title: Very good practice
body:
Unlike a lot of the reviews I have nothing but praise for the reception staff, the telephone staff, the nurses and most of all the doctor's. They have always been very helpful to me and I've had no problem with anyone.
The other reviews made me cross that's why I wanted to leave a positive review. I gave nothing but praise and gratitude to all the team there. I would like to thank each and everyone of you all.

author: Jelly Legs
title: Flu Clinic
body:
The prospect of this year’s flu vaccination filled me with dread, considering everything that was going on at the time. When I got the text from the practice I admit I was concerned, how long would I have to wait? Would I have to wait outside in the rain?  
On arrival at the practice I was greeted by two smiling faces waiting outside with clipboards, once I gave them my name that was it, “Through the door to the right, the nurse is waiting!” I went in rolled my sleeve up, confirmed my details and seconds later stepped out through the fire exit nursing a sore prick!  
The whole process was over in less than five minutes, I have never known such an efficient, well drilled process. Awesome job Hackenthorpe, thank you.

title: Superb treatment
body: I was recently treated for COVID-19 and I want to pass on my thanks and appreciation to all the staff at Barnsley Hospital. I was treated kindly and sympathetically. It was obvious the hospital was extremely busy but everyone was completely professional and friendly. Keep up the excellent work and again thank you.

title: Flu jab appointment - good experience
body: I and my wife had a flu jab appointment on 3rd October 2020. Goldsworth Medical Practice was well organised and ready at the appointed time. Having arrived early, we waited a few minutes before being let in. Our temperature was taken. We were cleared, and the vaccine was administered by a pleasant nurse.

author: Super suzie
title: Flu vaccination
body: It was really well organised. nurses outside telling you which queue to go in. 2 meters marked on floors. Two nurses in office one asking questions other giving injection and then telling how to vacate building. Well organised quick and smooth experience

title: Very Very POOR service
body:
NO Communication at all.
I still have no idea how to make contact with a doctor, in person or otherwise (no chance} receptionist refuses to help, simply says go online & book an online appointment, i normally use "Patient Access" for everything, that's out of commission currently cannot use to book anything, so the recording on the phone line when ringing the Surgery says go to a certain website to book an appointment however when i do this there's no option to book an appointment online, i feel now is the time to declare that the NHS GP service is no open for business, we now only have an A&E service available to the great British public, the only way to get any attendance seems to be go catch covid 19, this is very sad

title: A not good enough practice
body: After a blood test with a practice nurse I was told to book an appointment with Dr the receptionist informed me there were none available and to phone the following week which I did after 40 mins on hold I was told there were no appointments and to call back next week I realise these are difficult times but this is poor service

title: Impossible
body:
Tried for several days to contact surgery by telephone to make a appointment .Finally got through in the afternoon after about 50 phone calls over 3 days  only to be told none left ring in the morning.
Tried to book on line via Patient Access but cannot book on line.
I still have not got a appointment and will start the saga all over again tomorrow
It is pretty obvious that patient communication is not on their  list of priorities

title: Discriminating
body:
When phoning for a repeat prescription, being on the phone for 50 plus minutes to be told they can't take your prescription order over the phone as you are not 'housebound' simply because it does not take into account any other mobility issues. Second time this has happened. After the first time we spoke to the practice and they agreed to add it to record that we were able to phone up to order prescriptions as we are unable to access other services.

Review written by Daughter on their behalf.

title: I hate this surgery!
body: Had a telephone appointment booked for 11.20am.  Missed a call from the doctors at 10.10am.  Why am I making an appointment??  I did not get any phone call back at the allotted time so I had to ring them.  Was told by one of the rude receptionists that the doctor could ring at any time, again why am wasting my time making an appointment.  3 days later I have a prescription query  Have to phone between 10 & 12. Fair Enough!  When I rang the receptionist told me she hadn't a clue what I was on about and will get the nurse to call me back, again fair enough, That's if you get a call back from the nurse!  She didn't even bother. I dread having to deal with this surgery!

title: Repeat prescriptions
body: This year my monthly request for renewed prescriptions has failed to materialise THREE TIMES at the local pharmarcy, although ordered in the normal manner.     One could blame Covid-19 for two occasions but the first occurrence was before the first lockdown so this appears to be a system fault that needs attention - by the CLMP?

title: Rude doctor
body: One of the doctors was rude and told me I’m going round in circles and repeating the same things when I was just concerned about the health of my grandad. There is a way to tell me your opinion, not directly be rude! I’m so disgusted that this is how they speak to patients just because of their position.

title: Made everything worse.
body:
Camhs hasn't done good for me, it's made me worse...
I'm pretty young granted, but Camhs has made my life way more stressful than it already is. 
My worker claims I'm simply "confused" and I don't need to look into mental illness, I know the Camhs worker is a professional but I've only been with them a little bit and they always try to find a start with me. That's the point, they can't because I've been having these bad symptoms for years now and it's only gotten worse since I've came.

Would NOT recommend. This is only from me working with one worker I'm sure there are better workers at Camhs but right now I hate it.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: absolutely appalling
body: My partner Had an appointment today at 2.15pm with a nurse for a blood pressure check as he's had to self monitor for the lasts 2 weeks and was told to go and buy his own machine! His appointment was  at newland surgery( even though his actual surgery is new hall!) After checking in at reception and sat waiting for nearly 2 hours he was told his appointment was cancelled earlier today and he should have had a phone call!! Why was he allowed to even check in if his appointment was cancelled?????? His blood pressure is high and has been  since hes been monitoring himself so hes high risk of heart attack/ stroke!!!They had rebooked his appointment for 1st Dec without asking if it was convenient as he had already taken today off work today to attend! Why was he not told !! ##No communication, patients left to their own devices, told to buy their own devices, no duty of care!!!!!! ##
